title: Kate Middleton adds new person to tour entourage
text:

Whenever members of the Royal Family go on Tour, they take a whole team of staff along with them to make sure everything runs smoothly.

As well as their most trusted security guards there are hairdressers, nannies, assistants and social media gurus on hand at all time to help out.

But for their current trip to Pakistan , the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have added another name to their entourage - and it's a professional normally reserved for the Queen and Prince Philip.

According to royal reporter Rebecca English, they have taken a tour doctor with them for the five-day trip.

This means they will always have someone on hand if either of them get sick during their time there.

(Image: WireImage)

And rather than just taking a doctor they don't know, they've asked one of William's old friends from his days with the East Anglian Air Ambulance for the important job.

Private secretaries Simon Case and Catherine Quinn are also on the trip with the Cambridges, along with communications secretary Christian Jones and four other members of the comms team.

There are also two assistant private secretaries, their PA, programme coordinators and Kate's hairdresser.

The couple will spend five days in Pakistan on what has been described as one of the "most complex Royal Tours ever".

Their exact movements and engagements will not be published until the last minute and they will be looked after by a 'ring of steel' made up of about 1,000 police officers.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: PA)

They've decided to leave kids Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis at home, and Kate's parents Carole and Michael Middleton are looking after them.

However they did arrange their flights around the children, allowing them to drop them off at school on Monday morning before starting their trip.

The main focuses of the trip are education and climate change, and they will be visiting sites and organisations which raise awareness of these issues.

(Image: NEIL HALL/POOL/EPA-EFE/REX)

So far they have met children at a number of different schools and travelled to see a glacier and the towns around it which have suffered flood damage due to it melting.

Communications secretary Christian Jones said: "This is the most complex tour undertaken by the Duke and Duchess to date, given the logistical and security considerations.

"Pakistan hosts one of Britain’s largest overseas networks, with the British High Commission in Islamabad being one of the UK's largest diplomatic missions in the world.

"The UK's links with Pakistan are extensive, and Their Royal Highnesses are looking forward to building a lasting friendship with the people of Pakistan."
description: Kate Middleton and Prince William have taken 14 members of staff with them for their Pakistan Royal Tour
